data.enText: to come out of an egg

before.enText: of a young bird, fish, insect, etc.

data.enText: Ten chicks hatched (out) this morning.
data.chText: 今早有十只小鸡出壳了。

data.enText: to break open so that a young bird, fish, insect, etc. can come out
The eggs are about to hatch.
to make a young bird, fish, insect, etc. come out of an egg
data.chText: 使（小鸟、小鱼、小虫等）孵出

data.enText: The female must find a warm place to hatch her eggs.
data.chText: 母的必须找个温暖的地方孵蛋。

data.enText: to create a plan or idea, especially in secret
Have you been hatching up a deal with her?
data.chText: 你是不是在和她密谋什么交易？

data.id-g-sent: Don't count your chickens (before they are hatched).

data.enText: hatchway
an opening or a door in the deck of a ship or the bottom of an aircraft, through which goods to be carried are passed
data.chText: （船甲板或飞机底部装货物的）舱口

data.enText: an opening in a wall between two rooms, especially a kitchen and a dining room , through which food can be passed
data.chText: （尤指厨房和餐厅之间供传递食物的）两室之间的小窗口

data.enText: a serving hatch
a door in an aircraft or a spacecraft
an escape hatch
an opening or a door in a floor or ceiling
data.chText: （地面或天花板的）开口，门，盖子

data.enText: a hatch to the attic
down the hatch
used before drinking sth, especially to express good wishes before drinking alcohol

means: 使(小鸟、小鱼、小虫等)孵出
(船甲板或飞机底部装货物的)舱口
(尤指厨房和餐厅之间供传递食物的)两室之间的小窗口

ex.enText: The hen broods eight eggs this time.

synonyms.bx: 尤指禽类孵蛋，直至幼禽破壳而出。

ex.enText: The eggs take over a week to hatch.
ex.chText: 这些蛋需要一个多星期才能孵化。

synonyms.bx: 普通用词，指蛋破壳或孵出幼禽、小鱼、小虫等。

ex.enText: The female bird incubates the eggs for about 16 days while the male brings food.
ex.chText: 雌鸟孵卵16天左右，这期间雄鸟负责觅食。

synonyms.bx: 指禽类孵卵或蛋，或指卵、蛋等处于温暖的环境中直到被孵化。

data.enText: don't count your chickens (before they are hatched)
you should not be too confident that sth will be successful, because sth may still go wrong
data.chText: 不要蛋未孵化先数小鸡；别过早打如意算盘

data.enText: down the hatch
used before drinking sth, especially to express good wishes before drinking alcohol
batten down the hatches
to prepare yourself for a period of difficulty or trouble
to firmly shut all the entrances to the lower part, especially because a storm is expected

tr: a movable barrier covering a hatchway
shading consisting of multiple crossing lines
the production of young from an egg

example: young birds, fish, and reptiles hatch

tr: draw, cut, or engrave lines, usually parallel, on metal, wood, or paper

example: He thought up a plan to get rich quickly
no-one had ever thought of such a clever piece of software

tr: inlay with narrow strips or lines of a different substance such as gold or silver, for the purpose of decorating

example.ex: As soon as the two chicks hatch, they leave the nest burrow...
example.tran: 两只小鸟一出壳就离开了巢穴。

example.ex: The young disappeared soon after they were hatched.
example.tran: 雏鸟出壳后不久就不见了。

value.def: When a baby bird, insect, or other animal hatches, or when it is hatched, it comes out of its egg by breaking the shell.

example.ex: The eggs hatch after a week or ten days...
During these periods the birds will lie on the cage floor as if trying to lay or hatch eggs.
example.tran: 这些时期，鸟儿会趴在笼底，好像在下蛋或孵蛋。

example.ex: Seeing the eggs hatch out for the first time is a moment that I will never forget.
example.tran: 第一次看到蛋孵化的那一刻令我永世难忘。

gramarinfo.label: Also V n P, V P n (not pron)

value.def: When an egg hatches or when a bird, insect, or other animal hatches an egg, the egg breaks open and a baby comes out.

example.ex: He has accused opposition parties of hatching a plot to assassinate the Pope.
example.tran: 他指控反对党密谋暗杀教皇。

value.def: If you hatch a plot or a scheme, you think of it and work it out.

example.ex: He stuck his head up through the hatch...
All deck fittings, windows, hatches and doors had been fastened.
example.tran: 甲板上所有的装置、窗户、舱口盖和门都已经关牢了。

value.def: A hatch is an opening in the deck of a ship, through which people or cargo can go. You can also refer to the door of this opening as a hatch.
A hatch is an opening in a ceiling or a wall, especially between a kitchen and a dining room, which you can pass something such as food through.
value.tran: （墙上或屋顶的）小窗口;（尤指厨房和餐厅间传递菜肴等的）小窗口，传菜口

example.ex: Many firms are battening down the hatches and preparing to ride out the storm.
example.tran: 很多公司正在加紧准备，希望能挺过这场暴风雨。

value.def: If someone battens down the hatches, they prepare themselves so that they will be able to survive a coming difficulty or crisis.
value.tran: 做好准备（迎接挑战）；未雨绸缪
